alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 26 at 3:07PM MST until July 26 at 5:30PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON FOR AREAS NEAR DEWEY-HUMBOLDT AND SOUTHEASTWARD IN YAVAPAI COUNTY... At 305 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated the heavier rainfall has ended across the warned area. However, flash flooding is still expected as water drains. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Prescott Valley, Dewey-humboldt and Lynx Lake Dam. This includes the following highways... State Route 69 between mile markers 277 and 288...and between mile markers 291 and 293. Interstate 17 between mile markers 264 and 270. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Brushy Wash, Yarber Wash, Big Bug Creek, Hackberry Wash, Cherry Creek, Chaparral Gulch, Lynx Creek, Osborne Spring Wash, Granite Creek, Little Hackberry Wash, Agua Fria River, Ash Creek, Coyote Wash and Racetrack Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
